org.fluidity.composition.spi

Interface ComponentInterceptor<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the optional class of the dependency this interceptor expects; when specified by an interceptor class, the corresponding interceptor will only be invoked for dependency references that are compatible with this type.

    @ComponentGroup
public interface ComponentInterceptor<T>
    Replaces a component before it is injected as a dependency. The replaced component must be type compatible with the dependency reference.

    Interceptors visible to a dependency injection container are invoked at all dependency injection operations performed by that container, and are the means to implement delegation chains in Fluid Tools.

    The list of interceptors applied is determined by the context at the dependency reference, which also determines the order in which the interceptors are invoked.

    If present, the @Component.Qualifiers annotation of the interceptor is consulted to determine what dependency references will the interceptor be invoked for: it will be invoked for those dependency references that have all listed qualifier annotations present. Qualifier annotations used by an interceptor have no effect on the context passed to the replaced component.

    The interceptor may also elect not to discriminate between the dependencies by their context, in which case it will be invoked for all dependency references.

    The interceptor can inspect the dependency reference itself to determine what action to take and it can use the Generics tool to work with parameterized types.

    Usage

     @Component.Qualifiers(MyAnnotation.class)
 final class MyInterceptor implements ComponentInterceptor {
   …
 }
 
     @Component
 public final class SomeComponent {

   SomeComponent(final @MyAnnotation SomeDependency dependency) {
     …
   }
 }

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Dependency<T> intercept(Type reference, ComponentContext context, Dependency<T> dependency)
      Replaces some dependency with a type compatible substitute.

    • Method Detail

      • intercept

        Dependency<T> intercept(Type reference,
                        ComponentContext context,
                        Dependency<T> dependency)
        Replaces some dependency with a type compatible substitute. The interceptor is never invoked with a null dependency and returning a null dependency will short-cut the interceptor chain and result in an unresolved dependency.

        The interceptor cannot invoke Dependency.instance() in this method.

        Parameters:
        reference - the fully specified reference to the dependency, including type parameters, if any.
        context - the component context at the dependency reference, with none of the qualifier annotations accepted by the interceptor missing.
        dependency - the dependency to intercept; never null.
        Returns:
        the replaced dependency; may be null.
